overview: From the memoirs of Ivan Alekseevich Bunin - a writer and poet who received the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1933 - with the wording "for the strict skill with which he develops the traditions of Russian classical prose." In this series, we learn under what circumstances Bunin learned that he received the highest award in the field of art, how he felt about this event and what he thought about in those days.
title: Bunin, Living Memories Cycle
